result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. Tibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin R. Tibbs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin R. Tibbs was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants a stay of the fine and costs pending an appeal of the final order of the Court.  If appeal is unsuccessful, must be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court.

Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Can serve half on electronic home monitor if the jail finds he is an appropriate candidate.
Can serve in another county if he finds employment in another county.
DOT Assessment is not ordered since he has already done so, but he must comply with the Driver's Safety Plan.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Benjamin R. Tibbs in court with attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:28 am  Case is called.
This is set for a trial before the Court.

Atty Zell makes arguments to the Court.
Court questions Atty Zell.
Atty Murray makes arguments to the Court.
Court questions Atty Murray.

Court questions Defendant re: waiving his Constitutional Rights.
Defendant agrees and wishes to proceed.

Court is going to review the incident report and would just write a written decision on guilt or innocence.
Atty Zell makes statements to the Court re: their understanding was the Court could just give an oral decision.

11:37 am  Court is in recess for 10 minutes while he reads the incident report and comes to a decision.
11:50 am  Court is back in session.

Court questions attorneys re: blood draw.
Atty Zell makes statements to the Court re: there was a refusal.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Mr. Tibbs guilty of Operating While Intoxicated as a Second Offense.

Court states the stipulation of the parties, admits the attachment, and understands that Atty Murray is going to argue regarding sentencing.

Atty Murray makes sentencing arguments to the Court.
Atty Zell makes sentencing arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Fine + Costs totaling: $1,870 + $200 for the DNA Surcharge
Court grants a stay of the fine and costs pending an appeal of the final order of the Court.  If appeal is unsuccessful, must be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court.  
60 days Jail
1 day Jail Credit
Entitled to Huber.
Can serve half on electronic home monitor if the jail finds he is an appropriate candidate.
Can serve in another county if he finds employment in another county.
18 months Revocation of License
18 months Ignition Interlock Device
DOT Assessment is not ordered since he has already done so, but he must comply with the Driver's Safety Plan.
Stipulated Agreement & Waiver to Jury Trial
Court trial on September 18, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 24, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Decision on May 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Decision and Order /s/ RJS 04/21/17 - For the reasons stated and upon the record at the hearing of March 23, 2017. the defendant's motion is DENIED

/s/ RJS 04/18/17 -  IT IS ORDERED that the defendant's motion to barr consideration of Mr Tibbs prior conviction and to exclude evidence relating to this refusal to permit an evidentiary chemical test of his blood are, for the reasons stated upon this record at the hearing, DENIED.
Defendant Record Update
Decision on May 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Memorandum in Support of Motion to Bar Consideration of Prior 2007 Conviction
Park Decision is an attachment of Supplemental Memorandum of Law
Silvers Decision is an attachment of Supplemental Memorandum of Law
Walters Decision is an attachmen to the Supplemental Memorandum of Law
Supplemental Memorandum of Law
Pre-trial conference on April 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin R. Tibbs in court with attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:18 am Court calls the case and states the appearances.
This was set for a hearing on Atty Murray's motions.

Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court re: Atty Murray is withdrawing one motion and continuing with one motion today.
Atty Murray makes arguments to the Court re: earlier conviction.
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Murray makes additional arguments to the Court.
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
For the purpose of the motion, Court denies that motion and permits the parties to make a complete record to file whatever they would like if they would like the Court to reconsider.  Court will allow 15 days, or this matter would be closed, and the case will continue.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
